title: How to Motivate Frontline Employees
excerpt: One question that has long plagued organizations is how to create high-performing front lines â€” without unexpected consequences. The solution may be simple: Focus on motivating frontline workers. An experiment with a national retail organization found that transforming the operating model of some stores, to boost the motivation of their employees, raised productivity, customer satisfaction, and sales. The key was to get rid of motivational tactics that created emotional and economic pressure on employees, and instead build systems to encourage learning and a sense of play and purpose in the work.
